intro: Howittia trilocularis, commonly known as the three-chambered bladderwort, is a carnivorous plant native to Australia. It belongs to the family Lentibulariaceae and is characterized by its small, bladder-like structures used to trap prey. The plant typically grows in wet, nutrient-poor environments such as swamps and marshes. Its leaves are usually submerged, while its flowering stems rise above the water surface. Howittia trilocularis plays an important ecological role in its habitat by controlling insect populations and contributing to nutrient cycling.
